intro: Ledermanniella kamerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon moss, is a species of liverwort found in tropical regions. It belongs to the family Pottiaceae and is characterized by its small, leafy structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as on rocks or soil in forest understories. Its morphology includes a thallus that is often crinkled and covered with small, closely packed leaves. Ledermanniella kamerunensis plays a role in soil stabilization and contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
